items.title: After Charlie Kirk’s Death, Voters Agree Something Is Wrong in US
items.summary: In interviews from across the country, people expressed fear and wariness, and said that the country seemed to be spinning out of control.

items.title: Voucher Push Is Reshaping Private School Education, Study Finds
items.summary: Vouchers are spurring the growth of low-priced, Christian schools that often serve small populations of students. They’re also pushing up tuition prices.

items.title: Patriots Owner’s Son Drops Out of Boston Mayoral Race
items.summary: Josh Kraft had harshly criticized the policies of Mayor Michelle Wu, a fellow Democrat, but his message did not resonate with voters.

items.title: Lawyers for Venezuelans Ask Court to Press D.H.S. on Temporary Protections
items.summary: A judge had ordered that Temporary Protected Status be kept in place, but Venezuelans who needed to re-register weren’t able to.

items.title: Homeless Funding Was Limited to Groups Aligned With Trump Policies, Suit Says
items.summary: The Trump administration had imposed conditions on grants awarded by the Department of Housing and Urban Development that critics viewed as overtly political.

items.title: Charlie Kirk shooting latest: Trump says ‘with high degree of certainty’ suspect is in custody
items.summary: <p>President makes remark during interview with Fox News at their studio in New York</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/12/charlie-kirk-shooting-new-video-of-suspect-released-by-fbi-asamid-urgent-appeal-for-help-from-the-public">Charlie Kirk shooting suspect arrested, says Trump: ‘We have him in custody’</a></p></li><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/12/charlie-kirk-young-conservatives-social-media">How Charlie Kirk pushed a new generation to the right</a></p></li></ul><p>Here are some images coming to us via the wires.</p><p>Democracy is the way that we have diverse societies that don’t kill each other, largely,” Lilliana Mason, a leading scholar of partisanship, <a href="https://youtube.com/watch?v=vIQiVQ21VN0">observed recently</a>. She added: “As soon as we stop believing in it, it disappears.” Dr Mason’s own research suggests that there is sharply rising tolerance of political violence. On Wednesday, it claimed one more victim.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/sep/12/charlie-kirk-shooter-suspect-latest-news-updates-donald-trump-utah">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Workplace safety issues at Georgia’s Hyundai plant may have led to Ice raid
items.summary: <p>Three people have died in two years at the South Korean Hyundai-LG battery plant in Ellabell</p><p>A week after a federal immigration raid on a South Korean battery plant under construction in Georgia, concerns over the economic fallout have reverberated between the United States and South Korea. The detention of more than 300 Korean workers at the Hyundai-LG worksite in Ellabell has created uncertainty both about the future of the project and those like it in Georgia, as well as the exact reasons for the aggressive and unusual workplace raid.</p><p>One reason that may have driven immigration officials to take actions that threaten an important trade relationship and a politically and economically sensitive development in one of the poorest parts of the US: workplace safety issues that led to three deaths in two years.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/12/immigration-georgia-hyundai-south-korea">Continue reading...</a>
